subsections.title: Measuring SWR, Effects of High SWR
subsections.label: subsec:measuring-swr
prompts: Explain the concept of SWR (Standing Wave Ratio) and its significance in radio communication.
Describe how an SWR meter works and what a 1:1 reading indicates.
Discuss the effects of high SWR on solid-state transmitters and why output power is reduced to protect the amplifier transistors.
Explain the role of a directional wattmeter in measuring SWR and how it differs from other instruments like voltmeters or ohmmeters.

subsections.title: Coax Failures, Installation
subsections.label: subsec:coax-fail
prompts: Explain the common causes of coaxial cable failures, focusing on moisture contamination and its impact on signal integrity.
Discuss why the outer jacket of coaxial cable should be resistant to ultraviolet light and how UV exposure can lead to cable damage.
Compare air core coaxial cable with foam or solid dielectric types, highlighting the disadvantages of air core cables, especially in preventing moisture ingress.
